description: Returns the number of open proactive insights, open reactive insights, and the Mean Time to Recover (MTTR) for all closed insights in resource collections in your account. You specify the type of Amazon Web Services resources collection. The two types of Amazon Web Services resource collections supported are Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks and Amazon Web Services resources that contain the same Amazon Web Services tag. DevOps Guru can be configured to analyze the Amazon Web Services resources that are defined in the stacks or that are tagged using the same tag key. You can specify up to 500 Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks.

parameters.name: ResourceCollectionType
parameters.description: An Amazon Web Services resource collection type. This type specifies how analyzed Amazon Web Services resources are defined. The two types of Amazon Web Services resource collections supported are Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks and Amazon Web Services resources that contain the same Amazon Web Services tag. DevOps Guru can be configured to analyze the Amazon Web Services resources that are defined in the stacks or that are tagged using the same tag key. You can specify up to 500 Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stacks.

nested_items.name: CloudFormation
nested_items.description: The returned CloudFormationHealthOverview object that contains an InsightHealthOverview object with the requested system health information.

nested_items.name: StackName
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudFormation stack.

nested_items.name: OpenProactiveInsights
nested_items.description: The number of open proactive insights.

nested_items.name: OpenReactiveInsights
nested_items.description: The number of open reactive insights.

nested_items.name: MeanTimeToRecoverInMilliseconds
nested_items.description: The Meant Time to Recover (MTTR) for the insight.

nested_items.name: AnalyzedResourceCount
nested_items.description: Number of resources that DevOps Guru is monitoring in your account that are specified by an Amazon Web Services CloudFormation stack.

nested_items.name: Service
nested_items.description: An array of ServiceHealth objects that describes the health of the Amazon Web Services services associated with the resources in the collection.

nested_items.name: ServiceName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Web Services service.

nested_items.name: OpenProactiveInsights
nested_items.description: The number of open proactive insights in the Amazon Web Services service.

nested_items.name: OpenReactiveInsights
nested_items.description: The number of open reactive insights in the Amazon Web Services service.

nested_items.name: AnalyzedResourceCount
nested_items.description: Number of resources that DevOps Guru is monitoring in an analyzed Amazon Web Services service.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The pagination token to use to retrieve the next page of results for this operation. If there are no more pages, this value is null.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services tags that are used by resources in the resource collection.

nested_items.type: for example, CostCenter, Environment, Project, or Secret
nested_items.description: A tag key (for example, CostCenter, Environment, Project, or Secret). Tag keys are case-sensitive.

nested_items.type: for example, 111122223333, Production, or a team name
nested_items.description: An optional field known as a tag value (for example, 111122223333, Production, or a team name). Omitting the tag value is the same as using an empty string. Like tag keys, tag values are case-sensitive.
